did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.abstract: Collection contains materials relating to Peterson's long acting career. Types of materials include scripts to his television, film, and stage roles, correspondence, and props used by Peterson.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Arthur Peterson papers, Collection #C0027, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection donated by Lorraine Brown in 1992

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Special Collections and Archives staff. EAD markup completed in March 2009 by Eron Ackerman and Jordan Patty.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Arthur Peterson played character and supporting roles on stage, television, and feature films. On television, fans of the series Soap (1977-1981), a spoof on soap operas, may remember Peterson as the Major. Born in North Dakota, Peterson first obtained a degree in theater from the University of Minnesota before becoming a professional actor with the Federal Theater Project. Peterson made his media debut in 1936 with a regular role on the radio serial The Guiding Light. During WWII, Peterson fought within General Patton's third regiment. Upon his discharge, Peterson appeared in the ABC network's first situation comedy, That's O'Toole. Peterson's stage work included appearances in such plays as Inherit the Wind. His film credits include Return to Peyton Place (1961), Born Wild (1968), the television movie Rollercoaster (1977), and Just Pals (1982). Peterson spent 1981 to 1991 touring the country with his wife in a Pasadena Playhouse production of The Gin Game. When the play's long run ended, Peterson retired from acting. He passed away on October 31, 1996.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection contains materials relating to Peterson's long acting career. Types of materials include scripts to his television, film, and stage roles, correspondence, and props used by Peterson.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged alphabetically by subject and production title.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Special Collections and Archives also holds many other theatre collections.
